description: Borrowed from Middle French incapable, in- +â€Ž capable.

adjectives.description: incapable (comparative more incapable, superlative most incapable)

examples: A pint glass is incapable of holding more than a pint of liquid.
I consider him incapable of dishonesty.

entries.meaning: Not in a state to receive; not receptive; not susceptible; not able to admit.
examples: incapable of pain, or pleasure; incapable of stain or injury

entries.meaning: (dated) One who is morally or mentally weak or inefficient; an imbecile; a simpleton.
